001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.activations;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004
005/**
006 * Concrete {@link ActivationFunction} implementing the logistic sigmoid:
007 *
008 * <pre>
009 * σ(x) = 1 / (1 + e^{-x})
010 * </pre>
011 *
012 * <p>The sigmoid squashes any real-valued input into the (0, 1) interval and is
013 * commonly used for binary classification logits and hidden-layer activations.</p>
014 */
015@Strategy(role = Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
016public class Sigmoid implements ActivationFunction {
017
018    /**
019     * Applies the logistic sigmoid to the given logit.
020     *
021     * @param logit input value (pre-activation)
022     * @return σ(logit) in (0, 1)
023     */
024    @Override
025    public float activate(float logit) {
026        return 1.0f / (1.0f + (float) Math.exp(-logit));
027    }
028
029    /**
030     * Returns the gradient of the sigmoid at the given <em>output</em> value.
031     * <p>
032     * Given {@code output = σ(x)}, the derivative is {@code output * (1 - output)}.
033     * This avoids recomputing the activation and is numerically stable.
034     *
035     * @param output the sigmoid output value y = σ(x), expected in [0, 1]
036     * @return the gradient dσ/dx evaluated at the corresponding input x
037     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code output} is NaN or infinite
038     */
039    @Override
040    public float determineGradientForOutput(float output) {
041        if (!Float.isFinite(output)) {
042            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Output must be a finite number.");
043        }
044        // Clamp to [0,1] if callers might pass slightly out-of-range values due to numeric drift.
045        float properOutput = Math.min(1.0f, Math.max(0.0f, output));
046        return properOutput * (1.0f - properOutput);
047    }
048}
